---
layout: "../../layouts/BlogPost.astro"
title: "Generate single color base64 images in Python"
datetime: "2023-05-13"
tags: [frontend, python]
---

Today I learned that you create base64 encoded images in Python using the `base64` and `pillow` libraries.

```
pip install pillow
```

```python
import base64
import io
from PIL import Image

# Create a yellow image
image = Image.new('RGB', (224, 224), (255, 0, 0)) # red
# image = Image.new('RGB', (224, 224), (255, 255, 0)) # yellow
# image = Image.new('RGB', (224, 224), (0, 0, 255)) # blue

# Save the image to a BytesIO object
image_bytes = io.BytesIO()
image.save(image_bytes, format='PNG')
image_bytes.seek(0)

# Encode the image bytes to base64 string
base64_string = base64.b64encode(image_bytes.getvalue()).decode('utf-8')

print(f"data:image/webp;base64,{base64_string}")
```

Generated images
![red](data:image/webp;base64,)
![yellow](data:image/webp;base64,)
![blue](data:image/webp;base64,)
